instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message: Hello everyone I got a macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> were the fan spins after 1-2mim of connecting the magsafe and t it doesn't show a image. I checked the voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCKBKLT</SIGNAL> and I'm getting 0v on it. I tried a good working LCD and I'm still getting no image. The diode and fuse seem to be fine. Any suggestions? Thanks!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message: If there is no image why even bother measuring backlight circuit? You using a known good 2015 LCD? Must be 2015 model, nothing else works. History of the machine?
